intro: Xanthoxalis parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved goldencup, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and small, narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. It produces achenes as its fruit, which are dispersed by wind. Xanthoxalis parvifolia is often found in disturbed soils and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
